property.name: pos
property.help: Window position. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default position for the window.

property.name: size
property.help: Window size. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default size for the window.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the window, to indicate to the sizer layout mechanism that this is the minimum required size.

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for this window. This should not be use for a parent window if you don't want its font to be inherited by its children

property.name: fg
property.help: Sets the foreground colour of the window.

property.name: bg
property.help: Sets the background colour of the window.

option.name: wxSIMPLE_BORDER
option.help: Displays a thin border around the window. wxBORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxDOUBLE_BORDER
option.help: Displays a double border. Windows and Mac only.

option.name: wxSUNKEN_BORDER
option.help: Displays a sunken border.

option.name: wxRAISED_BORDER
option.help: Displays a raised border.

option.name: wxSTATIC_BORDER
option.help: Displays a border suitable for a static control. Windows only.

option.name: wxNO_BORDER
option.help: Displays no border, overriding the default border style for the window.

option.name: wxTRANSPARENT_WINDOW
option.help: The window is transparent, that is, it will not receive paint events. Windows only.

option.name: wxTAB_TRAVERSAL
option.help: Use this to enable tab traversal for non-dialog windows.

option.name: wxWANTS_CHARS
option.help: Use this to indicate that the window wants to get all char/key events for all keys - even for keys like TAB or ENTER which are usually used for dialog navigation and which wouldn't be generated without this style. If you need to use this style in order to get the arrows or etc., but would still like to have normal keyboard navigation take place, you should create and send a wxNavigationKeyEvent in response to the key events for Tab and Shift-Tab.

option.name: wxVSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a vertical scrollbar.

option.name: wxHSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a horizontal scrollbar.

option.name: wxALWAYS_SHOW_SB
option.help: If a window has scrollbars, disable them instead of hiding them when they are not needed (i.e. when the size of the window is big enough to not require the scrollbars to navigate it). This style is currently only implemented for wxMSW and wxUniversal and does nothing on the other platforms.

option.name: wxCLIP_CHILDREN
option.help: Use this style to eliminate flicker caused by the background being repainted, then children being painted over them. Windows only.

option.name: wxFULL_REPAINT_ON_RESIZE
option.help: Use this style to force a complete redraw of the window whenever it is resized instead of redrawing just the part of the window affected by resizing. Note that this was the behaviour by default before 2.5.1 release and that if you experience redraw problems with code which previously used to work you may want to try this. Currently this style applies on GTK+ 2 and Windows only, and full repainting is always done on other platforms.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents and the objects of the derived classes are forwarded to the parent window and so on recursively by default. Using this flag for the given window allows to block this propagation at this window, i.e. prevent the events from being propagated further upwards. Dialogs have this flag on by default.

option.name: wxWS_EX_TRANSIENT
option.help: Don't use this window as an implicit parent for the other windows: this must be used with transient windows as otherwise there is the risk of creating a dialog/frame with this window as a parent which would lead to a crash if the parent is destroyed before the child.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: This window should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: This window should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Attach a tooltip to the window.

property.name: enabled
property.help: Enable or disable the window for user input. Note that when a parent window is disabled, all of its children are disabled as well and they are reenabled again when the parent is.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Shows or hides the window.

option.name: wxBU_LEFT
option.help: Left-justifies the label. Windows and GTK+ only.

option.name: wxBU_TOP
option.help: Aligns the label to the top of the button. Windows and GTK+ only.

option.name: wxBU_RIGHT
option.help: Right-justifies the bitmap label. Windows and GTK+ only.

option.name: wxBU_BOTTOM
option.help: Aligns the label to the bottom of the button. Windows and GTK+ only.

option.name: wxBU_EXACTFIT
option.help: Creates the button as small as possible instead of making it of the standard size (which is the default behaviour).

option.name: wxNO_BORDER
option.help: Creates a flat button. Windows and GTK+ only.

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_ENTER
option.help: The control will generate the event wxEVT_COMMAND_TEXT_ENTER (otherwise pressing Enter key is either processed internally by the control or used for navigation between dialog controls).

option.name: wxTE_PROCESS_TAB
option.help: The control will receive wxEVT_CHAR events for TAB pressed - normally, TAB is used for passing to the next control in a dialog instead. For the control created with this style, you can still use Ctrl-Enter to pass to the next control from the keyboard.

option.name: wxTE_MULTILINE
option.help: The text control allows multiple lines.

option.name: wxTE_PASSWORD
option.help: The text will be echoed as asterisks.

option.name: wxTE_READONLY
option.help: The text will not be user-editable.

option.name: wxTE_RICH
option.help: Use rich text control under Windows, this allows to have more than 64KB of text in the control even under Win9x. This style is ignored under other platforms.

option.name: wxTE_RICH2
option.help: Use rich text control version 2.0 or 3.0 under Windows, this style is ignored under other platforms.

option.name: wxTE_AUTO_URL
option.help: Highlight the URLs and generate the wxTextUrlEvents when mouse events occur over them. This style is only supported for wxTE_RICH Windows and multi-line wxGTK2 text controls.

option.name: wxTE_NOHIDESEL
option.help: By default, the Windows text control doesn't show the selection when it doesn't have focus - use this style to force it to always show it. It doesn't do anything under other platforms.

option.name: wxHSCROLL
option.help: A horizontal scrollbar will be created and used, so that text won't be wrapped. No effect under wxGTK1.

option.name: wxTE_LEFT
option.help: The text in the control will be left-justified (default).

option.name: wxTE_CENTRE
option.help: The text in the control will be centered (currently wxMSW and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_RIGHT
option.help: The text in the control will be right-justified (currently wxMSW and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_DONTWRAP
option.help: Same as wxHSCROLL style: don't wrap at all, show horizontal scrollbar instead.

option.name: wxTE_CHARWRAP
option.help: Wrap the lines too long to be shown entirely at any position (wxUniv and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_WORDWRAP
option.help: Wrap the lines too long to be shown entirely at word boundaries (wxUniv and wxGTK2 only).

option.name: wxTE_BESTWRAP
option.help: Wrap the lines at word boundaries or at any other character if there are words longer than the window width (this is the default).

option.name: wxTE_CAPITALIZE
option.help: On PocketPC and Smartphone, causes the first letter to be capitalized.

option.name: wxALIGN_LEFT
option.help: Align the text to the left.

option.name: wxALIGN_RIGHT
option.help: Align the text to the right.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTRE
option.help: Center the text (horizontally).

option.name: wxST_NO_AUTORESIZE
option.help: By default, the control will adjust its size to exactly fit to the size of the text when SetLabel is called. If this style flag is given, the control will not change its size (this style is especially useful with controls which also have wxALIGN_RIGHT or CENTER style because otherwise they won't make sense any longer after a call to SetLabel).

property.name: choices
property.help: Contents of the Combo Box

option.name: wxCB_SIMPLE
option.help: Creates a combobox with a permanently displayed list. Windows only.

option.name: wxCB_DROPDOWN
option.help: Creates a combobox with a drop-down list.

option.name: wxCB_READONLY
option.help: Same as wxCB_DROPDOWN but only the strings specified as the combobox choices can be selected, it is impossible to select (even from a program) a string which is not in the choices list.

option.name: wxCB_SORT
option.help: Sorts the entries in the list alphabetically.

property.name: choices
property.help: Contents of the List Box.

property.name: style
property.help: Note that wxLB_SINGLE, wxLB_MULTIPLE and wxLB_EXTENDED styles are mutually exclusive and you can specify at most one of them (single selection is the default).

option.name: wxLB_SINGLE
option.help: Single-selection list.

option.name: wxLB_MULTIPLE
option.help: Multiple-selection list: the user can toggle multiple items on and off.

option.name: wxLB_EXTENDED
option.help: Extended-selection list: the user can select multiple items using the SHIFT key and the mouse or special key combinations.

option.name: wxLB_HSCROLL
option.help: Create horizontal scrollbar if contents are too wide (Windows only).

option.name: wxLB_ALWAYS_SB
option.help: Always show a vertical scrollbar.

option.name: wxLB_NEEDED_SB
option.help: Only create a vertical scrollbar if needed.

option.name: wxLB_SORT
option.help: The listbox contents are sorted in alphabetical order.

property.name: choices
property.help: Contents of the Radio Box.

property.name: majorDimension
property.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows (if style contains wxRA_SPECIFY_ROWS) or columns (if style contains wxRA_SPECIFY_COLS) for a two-dimensional radiobox.

property.name: rows
property.help: Number of Rows.

property.name: cols
property.help: Number of Columns.

option.name: wxMB_DOCKABLE
option.help: Allows the menu bar to be detached (wxGTK only).

property.name: label
property.help: Text for the menu item, as shown on the menu. An accelerator key can be specified using the ampersand '&' character.

property.name: shortcut
property.help: Optional shortcut keyboard shortcut. Remarks: The general syntax is any combination of "CTRL", "ALT" and "SHIFT" strings (case doesn't matter) separated by either '-' or '+' characters and followed by the accelerator itself. The accelerator may be any alphanumeric character, any function key (from F1 to F12)

property.name: help
property.help: Optional help string that will be shown on the status bar.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Bitmap for the menu item. (Windows and GTK+ only)

property.name: fields
property.help: Number of fields in the statusbar.

property.name: bitmapsize
property.help: Default size of each tool bitmap. The default bitmap size is 16 by 15 pixels.

property.name: margins
property.help: Values to be used as margins for the toolbar.

property.name: packing
property.help: Value used for spacing tools. Remarks: The packing is used for spacing in the vertical direction if the toolbar is horizontal, and for spacing in the horizontal direction if the toolbar is vertical.

property.name: separation
property.help: The default separator size. Remarks: This is the size between each toolbar tool.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: The primary tool bitmap.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Help string used in the tooltip.

property.name: statusbar
property.help: This string is shown in the statusbar (if any) of the parent frame when the mouse pointer is inside the tool.

property.name: choices
property.help: An array of strings with which to initialise the choice control.

property.name: selection
property.help: Initial selected choice.

property.name: value
property.help: Initial position for the slider.

property.name: minValue
property.help: Minimum slider position.

property.name: maxValue
property.help: Maximum slider position.

property.name: range
property.help: Integer range (maximum value) of the gauge.

property.name: value
property.help: Initial position for the gauge.
